summary: The Scale-Up Manufacturing Investment Company Act of 2025 aims to amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to establish a program supporting small and emerging manufacturers. It creates the Scale-Up Manufacturing Investment Company (SUMIC) Program, providing leverage to participating investment funds to invest in qualifying manufacturing projects, focusing on building commercial facilities and adopting emerging technologies. The bill defines key terms, sets criteria for selecting participating funds, outlines leverage provisions, and includes reporting and examination requirements.
